WorkItem.ClosedComment: The Conflagrate talent was changed in patch 3.3 - its now as follows:[Causes][Consumes] an Immolate or Shadowflame effect on the enemy target to instantly deal damage equal to 60% of your Immolate or Shadowflame, and causes an additional 20% damage over 6 sec.Fixed in changeset 44598.
WorkItem.Description: Warlock Rawr is calculating incorrect stat values due to it valuing Conflagrate way too high - it should be at about 20% or lower damage done, instead it is around 70%, thus calculating its average hit at 24k+ (instead of 7k+ it should be), and average crit over 50k (instead of 13k+ it should be). Rawr is assigning too much value in Crit rating due to this. iI do not know the math used in Rawr, so I can't say what's causing this. Perhaps the spell's cooldown has been left out it or maybe it has wrong coefficients. Bottom line is, Rawr does not work for Destruction due to this, and any result it gives can't be trusted.

Using those two calculations with 3000 spellpower and maximum ranks of each spell leaves Conflagrate hitting for 7492 and Immolate ticking for 1580. That simply doesn't bear out what actually happens in the game. We still have Conflagrate hitting too hard. That's 4 ticks plus 18.5%, not 4 ticks plus 8%. And, in fact, when I take a lot more fights (I've just checked a whole month's worth) into consideration it's actually probably closer to 6%.

Assume
* Immolate Base Damage = 785
* Immolate Spell Power Coefficient = 0,2 (From WowWiki and observed ingame result) per tick * 5 ticks  = 1
* 5/5 Emberstorm = 15% more fire damage
* 3/3 Improved Immolate = 30% more immolate damage
* 2/2 Aftermath = 6% more immolate dot damage
* Neither Spell stone or firestone equiped

Using 3000 spellpower:

Total Immolate Damage = (785 + 3000 * 1) * (1 + 0.15 + 0.3 + 0.06) = 3785 * 1.51 = 5715.35
Immolate Tick Damage = 5715.35 / 5 = 1143.07
"Conflagrate" damage = 1143.07 * 4 = 4572.28
Total Immolate Damage calculated for Conflagrate = (785 + 3000 * 1) * (1 + 0.3 + 0.06) * (1 + 0.15)  = 3785 * 1.36 * 1.15 = 5919.74
Immolate Tick Damage calculated for Conflagrate = 5919.74 / 5 = 1183.948
Real Conflagrate damage = 1183.948 * 4 = 4735.792

The real conflag damage is 4735.792 / 4572.28 = about 3,6% higher than expected.


Now we add a firestone to the mix

Total Immolate Damage = (785 + 3000 * 1) * (1 + 0.15 + 0.3 + 0.06) = 3785 * 1.51 = 5715.35
Immolate Tick Damage = 5715.35 / 5 = 1143.07
"Conflagrate" damage = 1143.07 * 4 = 4572.28
Total Immolate Damage calculated for Conflagrate = (785 + 3000 * 1) * (1 + 0.3 + 0.06 + 0.01) * (1 + 0.15)  = 3785 * 1.37 * 1.15 = 5963.2675
Immolate Tick Damage calculated for Conflagrate = 5963.2675 / 5 = 1192.6535
Real Conflagrate damage = 1192.6535 * 4 = 4770.614

The real conflag damage is 4770.614 / 4572.28 = about 4,3% higher than expected.

For Lulz we add the glyph aswell

Total Immolate Damage = (785 + 3000 * 1) * (1 + 0.15 + 0.3 + 0.06 + 0,1) = 3785 * 1.61 = 6093,85
Immolate Tick Damage = 6093,85 / 5 = 1218,77
"Conflagrate" damage = 1218,77 * 4 = 4875,08
Total Immolate Damage calculated for Conflagrate = (785 + 3000 * 1) * (1 + 0.3 + 0.06 + 0.01 + 0.1) * (1 + 0.15)  = 3785 * 1.47 * 1.15 = 6398,5425
Immolate Tick Damage calculated for Conflagrate = 6398,5425 / 5 = 1279,7085
Real Conflagrate damage = 1279,7085 * 4 = 5118,834

The real conflag damage is 5118,834 / 4875,08 = about 5% higher than expected.


By using the calculations for 0 spell damage you should get values matching the ingame tooltips.

Reservations for rounding errors as I dont know exactly where Blizzard applies rounding errors
